themes: Loss of venues and exodus of arts professionals
Disregard for professional expertise in funding decisions
Prioritization of amateurs and hobbyists over professionals
Comparison to other cities' collaborative approaches
Perceived lack of respect and understanding from program managers
Community division resulting from current funding strategies
key_phrases: unable to stem the loss of venues and exodus of arts and culture professionals
disregarding our expertise while prioritizing amateurs and hobbyists
betraying the people managing these program's complete lack of understanding and respect for the very idea of professional arts
empowered by their local funders to reach into their grassroots communities
threw much of its resources at people with no experience or expertise
wasted money, lost time and missed opportunities
barriers_identified: Lack of collaboration with professional sector
Paternalistic social theories by EDD staff
solutions_proposed: Listen to and work with the professional arts and culture sector
Empower professionals to reach grassroots communities and grow audience access and education opportunities
